summary:
An IT/IM professional with a background in creating and implementing upstream oil and gas data management solutions and business processes. I am skilled in coordinating with  large stakeholder groups across different time zones. I have held various roles including business analyst, project/product manager, and team leader, and have experience in planning and delivering technical product development. I am a proven leader with the ability to mentor and guide an organization through technological change.

I am a skilled strategic thinker with strong problem-solving skills and a track record of customer satisfaction with high-profile clients. I have experience in defining and executing new initiatives and translating customer needs into clear requirements. I am also experienced in developing and implementing product structures and pricing strategies, and managing software engineering projects across multiple distributed sites. As a professional with global experience in customer-facing roles, I am capable of making informed business decisions based on calculated risk-taking and have a successful track record of presenting and implementing new initiatives to executive leadership. I am also skilled at managing the entire product lifecycle from launch to retirement, with expertise in market and cost analysis.

I also have an extensive technical and business analysis backgrounds in oil and gas exploration and mid-stream activities with a full understanding of the E&P business cycle and data flow. I have experience in partnering with customers, regions, and internal peers to identify, define, and execute new initiatives. I am skilled at translating customer needs into clear solution and product requirements, and have experience developing and implementing product structures and pricing strategies. I am also experienced in driving software engineering projects across multiple product lines and distributed sites with competing resources and priorities.

Hands on "Plan Turnaround" experience gained in the Qatar Pearl GTL turnaround 2016. Was involved in the planning and acting as the application specialist for the planning tool ROSER Suite. 



Data manager/analyst – exploration, appraisal & venture set-up 
• Oil & gas information management and IM coordination
• Exploration and production information applications specialist
• Document management

Introduction to Upstream Business (40 hrs e learning + 2 weeks face to face training)

The Natural Gas Course (25 hrs e- learning + 2 days face to face training)
Well engineering for other disciplines (5 days face to face training)

profile_positions.description:
Working as a Product SME/Manager, managing and delivering global, large-scale data platform Product. Handling end-to-end Product Lifecycle Management. Leading globally distributed, multi-disciplinary and multi- cultural team. 
Responsibilities include the following:
•	Strategic planning and management of the Health & Safety related Data Analytics Platform of Shell.
•	Establishing goals and target metrics that design decisions can be mapped to, by aligning with the various stakeholders.
•	Building strategic partnerships and leading necessary  negotiations.
•	Translating business goals into innovative, creative and engaging product experiences. 
•	Translating complex relationships and solutions into easily understandable and visual representations, and strategies.
profile_positions.title: Product SME

profile_positions.description:
Received the 2021 CIO award for this role
In this role I worked in the Global JV/NOV IT excellence team at the strategic level (JV readiness process) and with the IT team of an NOV in Russia (SPD) for Opportunity framing, Impact assessment and supporting their day to day tasks.
Key Achievements:
Global JV IT excellence team
•	I finalized and implemented the JV Readiness process: It ensured proper upfront diligence of IRM, Architecture and Operations when providing IT services to an NOV to avoid project failures (due to incorrect scoping, mis-aligned delivery and cost escalations).
•	I led a team of IRM, Architecture and operations focal points to perform the JV readiness analysis for all the AMS point C applications. My work identified major gaps and recommended the focus area to work on, to ensure the applications are ready to be delivered to an NOV.

Russia (SPD) IT team
•	I worked on an Opportunity framing for SPD to transition basic IT services from Shell to an independent provider. The work identified that the cost of the opportunity at the time outweighed the benefits and the project was deferred to a later stage.
•	I performed a business impact assessment if SPD replaces Shell provided applications to reduce dependency. I worked with the local IT team, JV asset mgt. team, secondees in SPD and consulting global SMEs. This work highlighted the regret cost of replacing the various Shell applications.
profile_positions.title: JV/NOV Digitalization Advisor

profile_positions.description:
In this role I worked with the QGC Upstream business and acted as the Scrum Master/Business Analyst for the continued delivery and improvement of the Mobile Data Solution (MDS) under the Smart CSG program.
Key Achievements:

•	I led the MDS development and testing team (7 members), setting up a new process clearing MDS product backlog (~60 RFCs with 60% being medium/large in complexity) 2 months before time to save 7 FTE cost for 2 months.
•	Improved the end to end delivery process by optimizing sprint planning (changed to bi-weekly) and team co-ordination via DevOps.
•	Worked in the field with the Field operators and educating operators about what technology can do for them (1 week, 30 operators, f2f interaction). As a result, received request to digitize 8-10 more work processes from scratch and ~ 30 optimizations for the existing work processes to get detailed understanding of their day to day work.
•	I also performed detailed options analysis and proposed the future strategic direction for the MDS tool. Finalized 3 main options for detailed analysis and presented the outcome to the QGC leaders. Considering the cost impact and value add analysis, my recommendation was accepted to continue using the MDS tool for next 2 years. 
•	I successfully worked with business stakeholders who were considered "difficult and challenging" by IT (in QGC) utilizing my stakeholder management skills.
profile_positions.title: QGC - Business Analyst (Digitization)

profile_positions.description:
Delivered the Turnaround Planning Tool Solution (ROSER Suite) for Qatar Shell GTL enabling the Turnaround Business of the world’s largest GTL Plant. These Turnarounds are the largest within the Shell Group and each Turnaround event is in the order of Hundreds of Millions of Dollars.

Scope of work involved the delivery of applications (including Release management and conducting UAT) supporting the scoping, planning and execution of Turnaround jobs integrated with hardware peripherals like PDAs, progress tracking terminals, and barcode scanners.

IIn this role I worked as the global business analyst for WRFM, PMA and IAPS. I assisted the WRFM/PMA IT manager (and also the PTM IT manager) in conducting Application portfolio rationalization, planning strategic roadmaps and with insights for business meetings. I also led an implementation project and worked on two major IT initiatives (ITES and CPI) for both WRFM and PMA portfolio. 

Key Achievements:

ITES initiative
•	Conducted the application portfolio analysis of the WRFM, PTM and PMA areas -  My cost analysis work identified and created cost transparency to initiate a $5 million program to reduce run and maintain cost by 20%-30% per year (current cost ~ $23 million).
•	Identified applications which can be decommissioned after a capability migration to another tool (in short and medium term) ensuring long term health of the portfolio.
•	Based on the business strategic drivers, formulated and secured approval for the portfolio direction by senior stakeholders. 
•	Secured stakeholder buy-in for various application decommissioning across UP (and DS in some cases).
•	Created a proposal for an interim solution for the applications to be decommissioned in the longer term (5+ years), to ensure business continuity, in line with the agreed strategic direction. I also led one of the implementation projects for NAM and UK assets. 
•	Reduced the number of step-out applications by 35% via stakeholder engagements.
profile_positions.title: Application Delivery + Business Analyst (Qatar Pearl GTL turnaround + WRFM)

profile_positions.description:
I worked first at the strategic level (with the VP/VP-1) to draft the Technical Data Management discipline’s career ladder competencies and DCAF controls (with the input of various TDM team leads). Later, I created an opportunity for myself to work as an Embedded project data manager in Exploration teams (at the operational level).

Key Achievements:

•	Achieved better understanding of various disciplines (like Geology, Geophysics, Drilling, Production Technology) by attending various courses and daily working with Exploration team members.
•	Gained exposure to the Upstream IT application portfolio and first-hand feedback from the users in the team about the various tools

Embedded Data Manager/Analyst for Exploration teams in Shell handling holistic Data and Information Management in E&P
+ Technical Assurance of StartUp and Close Out for E&P Projects 
+ Conducted IM/DM Healthchecks/ Peer reviews for QA QC purposes
+ EP Catalog (X-ORP/ORP)
+ Creation and preparation of seismic and well data for Geological Analysis.
+ Set up of Petrel and GeoSigns NDi (Shell proprietary) projects for interpretation of seismic 2D and 3D data.
+ Openworks R5000 project set ups.
+ OpenSpirit, PowerExplorer, IHS, CDS and Recall for retrieval and basic QC/comparison of data.
+ Techlog to Recall transfers and data maintenance
+ Spot fire: linking into various DBs for cross plotting their contents.
+ Unix environment drive space management and basic scripting
+ Document management with Livelink, Sharepoint and Central Data Register(Data Entitlement and Obligation management) 
+ Creation of play maps in ArcGis and linking various DBs in for display on said map
+ Assisting the team with data loading, storage and hardcopy secure postage
+ Adhering to Shell data standards and respective project Confidentiality Agreements with the data Entitlement and obligations
profile_positions.title: Business Process Analyst / Project Data Manager

profile_positions.description:
Business Analyst - Capital Projects in Shell

1)	Established a document and control assurance framework together with a global team in the Capital Projects IM/IT of Shell. 

2)	Coordinated and organized promotional activities for the Capital Projects of Shell in UK, USA, The Netherlands, Canada and Nigeria.

3)	Implemented an integrated reporting solution for the Capital Projects IM/IT discipline team in SharePoint.

Business Analyst - Strategy, Planning, Reporting and Marketing 

1)     Business strategy - Contributed to the update of the strategy and the development of the platform maturation ; as well as to the presentation of these to the respective governance bodies (CTO Board, ITE, Portfolio Council, Platform DRB)

2)	Implemented a holistic, integrated and proactively driven Reporting framework for the Technical & Competitive IT (TaCIT) department of Shell.

The project included creation of the inventory of all TaCIT business and Financial reports (including known gaps) and implementation of an integrated reporting calendar together with a SharePoint developer which provided a timeline view of all the reports with meta data about the reports (owner, lead time etc.)

3)	Assessed and determined the methodology, tools, needs, responsibilities and time required to operationalise the end to end Engineering delivery (ESDV) department’s planning and reporting.

4)	Contributed to a Shell promotional movies’ creation, promotion and launch

5)	Schedule and executed global promotional events for the Technical & Competitive IT of Shell
profile_positions.title: Business Consultant (Strategy and Planning)

profile_positions.description:
Co authored a research paper which examined QR Codes and how they can be used to attack both human interaction and automated systems. As the encoded information is intended to be machine readable only, a human cannot distinguish between a valid and a maliciously manipulated QR code. While humans might fall for phishing attacks, automated readers are most likely vulnerable to SQL injections and command injections. Our contribution consisted of an analysis of the QR Code as an
attack vector, showing dierent attack strategies from the attackers point of view and exploring their possible consequences.
profile_positions.title: Information Security Intern
